page.title: 09BRANT BROUGHTON 1930-45
page.content: Some local people were interviewed about life in the past: "We didn't have a bathroom at all. We just kept a tin bath on the wall,so we had to fetch it in every time we wanted a bath.Then we would fill it using buckets of water from the copper.There were no electric irons. We had to heat one up in front of the fire.The toilet was at the bottom of the garden.We had to make our own entertainment.We played whip and tops down the street.A gang of us would start at Stragglethorpe and see who could keep it going all the way to Brant Broughton.We would sing songs around the piano at night. When war broke out we had to dig our own air raid shelter at the bottom of the garden, and when the gas masks were given out people weren't very keen on them at all."
